Interface IAudioPlayer

All Known Implementing Classes:
AudioPlayer, JOALAudioPlayer
public interface IAudioPlayer
The IAudioPlayer interface exposes the public methods that all audio players must implement.
Author:
Kenneth Barnett, Mike McShaffry Modified from the SAGE Audio package for the RAGE game engine by Juan E. Ruiz. Adapted for TAGE by Scott Gordon.
See Also:
  • Game Coding Complete

  • Method Details

    • getSourceID

      int getSourceID()
      Returns the ID of the audio source.

      NOTE: This method is implementation dependent.

    • getResource

      AudioResource getResource()
      Returns the AudioResource attached to the IAudioPlayer.

    • release

      void release()
      Releases the IAudioPlayer back to memory.

      NOTE: This method is implementation dependent.

    • play

      boolean play(int volume, boolean looping)
      Plays the IAudioPlayer's sound.
      Parameters:
      volume - - The volume at which to play the sound
      looping - - True if the sound should loop when finished; false to only play the sound once.
      Returns:
      True if the sound has successfully started playing; false otherwise.

    • stop

      boolean stop()
      Stops playing the IAudioPlayer's sound.
      Returns:
      True if the sound was successfully stopped; false otherwise.

    • pause

      boolean pause()
      Pauses the IAudioPlayer's sound.
      Returns:
      True if the sound was successfully paused; false otherwise.

    • resume

      boolean resume()
      Resume playing the IAudioPlayer's sound.
      Returns:
      True if the sound was successfully resumed; false otherwise.

    • togglePause

      boolean togglePause()
      Pauses/Unpauses the IAudioPlayer's sound.
      Returns:
      True if the sound was successfully toggled; false otherwise.

    • getIsPaused

      boolean getIsPaused()
      Returns true if the IAudioPlayer's sound is paused; false otherwise.

    • getIsPlaying

      boolean getIsPlaying()
      Returns true if the IAudioPlayer's sound is currently playing; false otherwise.

    • getIsLooping

      boolean getIsLooping()
      Returns true if the IAudioPlayer's sound is looping when it finishes; false otherwise.

    • setIsLooping

      void setIsLooping(boolean looping)
      Set whether or not the IAudioPlayer is looping the sound.

    • setPitch

      void setPitch(float pitch)
      Sets the pitch of the IAudioPlayer's sound.
      Parameters:
      pitch - - The pitch value that is greater than 0.

    • setVolume

      void setVolume(int volume)
      Sets the volume of the IAudioPlayer.
      Parameters:
      volume - - The volume value between 0 and 100 inclusive.

    • getVolume

      int getVolume()
      Returns the volume of the IAudioPlayer.

    • getProgress

      float getProgress()
      Returns the current playback progress of the IAudioPlayer in seconds.

    • getSoundType

      SoundType getSoundType()
      Returns the SoundType of the IAudioPlayer.

    • setLocation

      void setLocation(org.joml.Vector3f point)
      Sets the location of the IAudioPlayer in 3D space.

      NOTE: Method only implemented if the concrete audio system supports 3D sound.

      Parameters:
      point - - The point in 3D space the audio player is located at.

    • setVelocity

      void setVelocity(org.joml.Vector3f velocity)
      Sets the velocity of the IAudioPlayer.

      NOTE: Method only implemented if the concrete audio system supports 3D sound.

      Parameters:
      velocity - - The velocity vector of the audio player.

    • setEmitDirection

      void setEmitDirection(org.joml.Vector3f direction, float coneAngle)
      Sets the emit direction of the IAudioPlayer. Visually you can think of this as setting a "cone" around the audio player which will direct the sound in a particular direction.

      The zero vector (0,0,0) is the default direction which indicated that the audio source emitted from the audio player is not direction. Specifying a non-zero vector will make the source directional. Specifying a zero vector for a directional source will effectively mark it as non-direction.

      NOTE: Method only implemented if the concrete audio system supports 3D sound.

      Parameters:
      direction - - The direction in which the sound is emitting from the audio player.
      coneAngle - - The angle (in degrees) of the "cone" around the audio player. Default value is 360 degrees means the sound being emitted from the audio player is omni-directional.

    • setRollOff

      void setRollOff(float rollOff)
      Sets the roll off factor of the IAudioPlayer. This is used for distance attenuation calculations based on some attenuation model set by the API implementation of the audio manager.

      NOTE: Method only implemented if the concrete audio system supports 3D sound.

      Parameters:
      rollOff - - Values G.T. 1 make the sound get quieter much quicker the further the ear gets from the source. For a value = 0 distance attenuation is disabled. Range: [0, any]

    • setMinDistance

      void setMinDistance(float distance)
      Sets the minimum distance at which distance attenuation begins.

      NOTE: Method only implemented if the concrete audio system supports 3D sound.

      Parameters:
      distance - - The sound can't get any louder if we move closer to the emit point than this value; Range: [0, any]

    • setMaxDistance

      void setMaxDistance(float distance)
      Sets the maximum distance at which distance attenuation stops. This is used for distance attenuation calculations based on some attenuation model set by the API implementation of the audio manager.

      NOTE: Method only implemented if the concrete audio system supports 3D sound.

      Parameters:
      distance - - The sound can't get any quieter if we move further away from the emit point than this value; Range: [0, any]

    • getLocation

      org.joml.Vector3f getLocation()
      Returns the location in 3D space of the IAudioPlayer.

      NOTE: Method only implemented if the concrete audio system supports 3D sound.

    • getVelocity

      org.joml.Vector3f getVelocity()
      Returns the velocity vector of the IAudioPlayer.

      NOTE: Method only implemented if the concrete audio system supports 3D sound.
